authors: Nkayla Afshariyan For Daily Mail Australia
description: Australian fashion designer Simone Zimmermann and her husband Michael Redmond recently bought a three-storey mansion in North Bondi for $5.5 million
title: Simone Zimmerman buys $5.5m home in North Bondi
title_page: Simone Zimmerman buys $5.5m home in North Bondi | Daily Mail Online
text:
She's one-half of an Australian duo whose fashion label went from a stall at Paddington Markets to become a global brand with fans who spend as much as AU$5000 on a dress.
Now Simone Zimmermann has purchased a stunning $5.5 million home in prestigious North Bondi.
According to Domain, the Australian fashion designer and her husband Michael Redmond recently bought the three-storey mansion from Raine and Horne, Double Bay.
The $5.5million North Bondi house Australian fashion designer Simone Zimmermann recently bought
Designer Simone Zimmermann poses backstage at Zimmermann fashion show during Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week 2014
The property boasts three bedrooms and three bathrooms, complete with beachfront views, marbled interior and a barrel vaulted ceiling.
The home comes with triple parking, video intercom and keyless entry.
The master bedroom has a spa ensuite and the property sits on the esteemed Ben Buckler peninsula.
Simone is no stranger to Bondi, having lived nearby on Elliot Street and growing up in the Sydney area.
The two-storey home boasts marbled floors, a barrel vaulted ceiling and panoramic ocean views
With panoramic ocean views, Simone Zimmermann's new home is situated on the esteemed Ben Buckler peninsula
Simone (right) and her sister Nicky Zimmermann (left) pose with their models during a 2009 New York fashion show
The home is beautifully constructed with open plan indoor and outdoor living areas, modern kitchen and contains a study nook with breathtaking ocean views.
Simone and her sister Nicky have expanded their fashion empire to the US, having recently sealed an investment deal with growth equity firm General Atlantic.
The fashionista sisters currently have showrooms in Sydney, London, New York and Los Angeles.
Prices on their website range from AU$4950 for a dress, to $700 for a skirt and $295 for a sweater.
